00:00:20:060000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:00:20:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:20:060000.Dialogue: Will you please turn your shirt off?

00:00:22:210000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:00:22:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:22:210000.Dialogue: What? I'm giving myself dramatic entrance music. People will know I'm awesome and to be feared.

00:00:28:200000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:00:28:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:28:200000.Dialogue: Right. There's nothing more awesome and frightening than a man who's got music blasting from between his nipples.

00:00:37:110000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:00:37:110000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:39:200000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:00:39:200000.Speaker: Stuart
00:00:39:200000.Dialogue: Well, you might want to mark your Google calendars. Stan Lee is coming to do a signing on Thursday.

00:00:44:150000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:00:44:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:44:150000.Dialogue: Did he finally write a sequel to his autobiography? I'm sure ages 79 through 87 were just action-packed.

00:00:51:070000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:00:51:070000.Speaker: Stuart
00:00:51:070000.Dialogue: No, just a regular comic signing. My uncle is his dermatologist and Stan's doing him a favor.

00:00:57:140000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:00:57:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:57:140000.Dialogue: Oh, I don't want to know that! How can I possibly discuss with Stan Lee the scientific foundations for interstellar flight on a silver surfboard when part of my brain will be scanning his face for signs of contagious skin disease?

00:01:11:100000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:01:11:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:11:100000.Dialogue: Stan Lee does not have a contagious skin disease.

00:01:14:210000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:01:14:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:14:210000.Dialogue: Well, look who thinks he's Stuart's uncle now.

00:01:18:220000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:01:18:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:18:220000.Dialogue: Can't believe it. We're going to meet Stan Lee!

00:01:31:120000.Scene: The comic book store. Raj enters carrying an iPod with a speaker on his tee shirt. As he enters the shop he starts the iPod and the Darth Vader theme from Star Wars emerges from the speaker
00:01:31:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:31:120000.Dialogue: I'm sad to say I taught him those moves.

00:02:01:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:01:120000.Dialogue: I can't decide whether I want Stan Lee to autograph my Journey into Mystery 83, first appearance of Thor or my Fantastic Four number five, first appearance of Dr. Doom.

00:02:20:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:20:020000.Dialogue: Alex, I'm going to go with what is... you're a dumbass?

00:02:29:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:29:120000.Dialogue: I've decided I'm going to have Mr. Lee sign my copy of this month's Batman.

00:02:34:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:34:230000.Dialogue: That's crazy. Stan Lee had nothing to do with Batman.

00:02:38:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:38:030000.Dialogue: Yes, which is why no one else will ask him to sign one, and I will be the possessor of a unique, albeit confusing, artifact, which will set me apart from hoi polloi of comic book fandom.

00:02:48:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:48:140000.Dialogue: That's a great idea. I'm going to get him to sign a Batman as well.

00:02:53:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:53:060000.Dialogue: What is it about the word "unique" you don't understand?

00:02:57:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:57:010000.Dialogue: Ow! Damn, paper cut. Nothing worse than a paper cut.

00:03:00:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:00:200000.Dialogue: Well, obviously you don't remember your circumcision.

00:03:06:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:06:080000.Dialogue: There's Neosporin and Band-Aids in my top desk drawer.

00:03:08:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:08:210000.Dialogue: Why don't you keep that stuff in the bathroom?

00:03:12:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:12:040000.Dialogue: He does. And in the kitchen. And in the car. And in his pocket.

00:03:15:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:15:200000.Dialogue: Yeah, but the ones in my pocket are mine.

00:03:23:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:23:130000.Dialogue: Um... can you give me a hint?

00:03:40:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:40:140000.Dialogue: You have no idea who he is, do you?

00:03:43:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:43:000000.Dialogue: Of course I do. You're an important part of my life and I pay attention to the things you are interested in.

00:03:49:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:49:080000.Dialogue: Oh, good. Good. So, who's Stan Lee?

00:03:53:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:53:140000.Dialogue: Um... he was on Star Trek.

00:04:03:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:03:170000.Dialogue: Um... uh, Stan Lee. Ooh, he was in those goofy kung fu movies you love so much?

00:04:11:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:11:140000.Dialogue: Oh. So, is this Bruce Lee's nerdy brother, Stan?

00:04:16:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:16:210000.Dialogue: Sheldon, why do you have all these unopened paychecks in your desk?

00:04:20:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:20:230000.Dialogue: Because most of the things I'm planning to buy haven't been invented yet.

00:04:25:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:25:160000.Dialogue: There-there must be thousands of dollars here. Why don't you put it in the bank?

00:04:30:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:30:010000.Dialogue: I don't trust banks. I believe that when the robots rise up, ATMs will lead the charge.

00:04:36:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:36:220000.Dialogue: You've also got something from the Pasadena Municipal Court.

00:04:40:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:40:140000.Dialogue: Undoubtedly another snide response to my repeated letters complaining that the flags in front of the courthouse are flying in the wrong order. From left to right, it's supposed to be federal, state, and then city of Pasadena.

00:04:52:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:52:100000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. You sent more than one letter about that?

00:05:03:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:03:170000.Dialogue: Looks like you ran a red light on Marengo Avenue at 9:30 p.m. on November 16. They got you on a traffic camera. Nice picture.

00:05:18:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:18:080000.Dialogue: November 16? Penny, that's the evening you fell in your bathtub and I had to drive you to the emergency room.

00:05:29:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:29:210000.Dialogue: Penny, I have an eidetic memory. Also, that's a picture of you in the passenger seat holding your dislocated shoulder.

00:05:39:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:39:050000.Dialogue: Okay, then why is a summons for a traffic violation committed in your car, bearing your license plates, coming to me?

00:05:52:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:52:070000.Dialogue: Okay, look, they sent me the ticket. I told them I wasn't driving and they were all, "If it wasn't you, who was it?"

00:05:58:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:58:190000.Dialogue: No! It wasn't a betrayal. It was more of a "I can't afford any more points on my license." I already have to buy my insurance from this place in the Cayman Islands.

00:06:07:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:07:210000.Dialogue: But the only reason I was driving your car was because you were in distress and I was rescuing you.

00:06:13:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:13:100000.Dialogue: Yes, yes, look, and now you have a photo to remember that heroic day.

00:06:18:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:18:040000.Dialogue: It's not that big a deal. You just go down to the court on Thursday and you pay the fine.

00:06:23:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:23:180000.Dialogue: I'm not going to pay a fine. That would imply I'm guilty.

00:06:38:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:38:020000.Dialogue: I am not guilty. I only have a learner's permit. Penny was the teacher. When the light turned yellow she said "Go, go, go." So I went, went, went.

00:06:46:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:46:210000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm sorry. I'll be happy to reimburse you for the fine. You know, as soon as I get a part in a movie or my own TV series.

00:06:53:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:53:130000.Dialogue: You don't need to reimburse me because I'm not paying. On Thursday, I will have my day in court and justice will be done. In fact, I'm going to begin preparing my defense right now.

00:07:07:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:07:110000.Dialogue: Oh, that's right. Thursday is Stan Lee Day.

00:07:13:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:13:120000.Dialogue: Now you see what you've done?

00:07:16:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:16:210000.Dialogue: Because of you, we're all going to miss Stan Lee.

00:07:24:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:24:210000.Dialogue: Well, you're my friends. You'll be standing by my side, supporting me, feeding me legal precedents, and if you had the upper body strength, carrying me out on your shoulders when I'm victorious.

00:07:38:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:38:230000.Dialogue: Are you saying that you will not stand beside me as I plead my case?

00:07:45:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:45:230000.Dialogue: Wow. Uh, Stan Lee, or you in court. Uh, if this was Sophie's Choice it would've been a much shorter movie. No.

00:07:54:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:54:030000.Dialogue: Raj? You'll be there, won't you?

00:08:00:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:00:070000.Dialogue: All right, then. My so-called friends have forsaken me. So, I guess it'll just be me and my eyewitness.

00:08:11:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:11:200000.Dialogue: Please try to wear something appropriate. It won't help my case if the judge is busy trying to read the word "Juicy" scrawled across your buttocks.

00:08:24:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:24:090000.Dialogue: Penny. Penny. Penny. That's just wrong.

00:08:34:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:34:110000.Dialogue: Wait, hold on. Before we get to the courthouse, I'd like to call on your skills as an actress.

00:08:41:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:41:110000.Dialogue: I've taken the liberty of scripting your appearance on the witness stand because, let's face it, you're somewhat of a loose cannon. Now, don't worry; it's written in your vernacular. So shall we rehearse?

00:08:52:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:52:010000.Dialogue: Well, of course you have a choice. Although we live in a deterministic universe, each individual has free will. Now, sit down.

00:08:59:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:59:180000.Dialogue: I call your attention to the events of November 16. Do you remember that date?

00:09:10:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:10:180000.Dialogue: "If the court will excuse my homespun, corn-fed Nebraskan turn of phrase."

00:09:18:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:18:040000.Dialogue: "The reason that date is, like, "so totally fixed in my memory "is that I had the privilege to be witness to one of the most heroic acts I've ever seen in, like, ever."

00:09:33:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:33:180000.Dialogue: "Why, you did, sir. "You. Dr. Sheldon Cooper. And may I add, it is a privilege to know you."

00:09:42:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:42:040000.Dialogue: "There's no need for compliments. This court is only interested in the facts."

00:09:45:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:45:200000.Dialogue: "But it is a fact that it's a privilege to know you. Totally."

00:09:53:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:53:040000.Dialogue: A teardrop rolls down my cheek?!

00:09:56:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:56:150000.Dialogue: Only a suggestion. A catch in your throat would work just as well.

00:10:02:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:02:120000.Dialogue: "But it is a fact "that it's a privilege to know you. Totally."

00:10:12:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:12:140000.Dialogue: Maybe you should put on your "Juicy" pants again.

00:10:24:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:24:180000.Dialogue: Good morning, Your Honor. Dr. Sheldon Cooper appearing in pro se. That is to say, representing himself.

00:10:32:070000.Speaker: Judge
00:10:32:070000.Dialogue: I know what it means. I went to law school.

00:10:34:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:34:230000.Dialogue: And yet you wound up in traffic court.

00:10:38:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:38:180000.Dialogue: Anyway, if it would please the court, I'd like to begin with an opening statement.

00:10:43:030000.Speaker: Judge
00:10:43:030000.Dialogue: The court would advise you to make it quick, as the court had a dicey-looking breakfast burrito this morning and just took an Imodium.

00:10:51:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:51:110000.Dialogue: Very well. A quick opening statement. Like a milking stool, my case rests on three legs. I will demonstrate that I was improperly instructed in driving by a woman whose lack of respect for society borders on the sociopathic. I will argue that the emergency met the legal doctrine of quod est necessarium est licitum-- that which is necessary is legal. But first, I will raise a Sixth Amendment issue. I'm unable to confront my accuser, a non-human entity, to wit, a camera. So, to sum up: improper instruction; quod est necessarium est licitum; Sixth Amendment. My milk stool is complete.

00:11:36:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:36:230000.Dialogue: I object. You're completely ignoring the law.

00:11:40:020000.Speaker: Judge
00:11:40:020000.Dialogue: No, I'm following the law. I'm ignoring you.

00:11:43:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:43:160000.Dialogue: Really? I would point out that I am at the top of my profession, while you preside over the kiddy table of yours.

00:11:52:070000.Speaker: Judge
00:11:52:070000.Dialogue: Dr. Cooper, before I find you in contempt and throw you in jail, I'm going to give you a chance to apologize for that last remark.

00:11:59:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:59:080000.Dialogue: I am a scientist. I never apologize for the truth.

00:12:09:190000.Scene: A police cell. Three people sit on a bench inside. Sheldon points at the one on the end.
00:12:09:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:18:050000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:12:18:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:18:050000.Dialogue: ♪ I can't wait to ask Stan Lee why he insists on giving all his characters first and last names that start with the same letter.

00:12:24:230000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:12:24:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:24:230000.Dialogue: Oh, come on. Why would you do that?

00:12:27:100000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:12:27:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:27:100000.Dialogue: Bruce Banner, Reed Richards, Sue Storm, Stephen Strange, Otto Octavius, Silver Surfer, Peter Parker, oh, and worst of all, J. Jonah Jameson, Jr.

00:12:39:170000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:12:39:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:39:170000.Dialogue: Okay, I'm cutting. I'm not gonna talk to Stan Lee after you cheese him off.

00:12:49:180000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:12:49:180000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:51:030000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:12:51:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:52:140000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:12:52:140000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:53:220000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:12:53:220000.Speaker: Raj

00:12:57:040000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:12:57:040000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:58:220000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:12:58:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:58:220000.Dialogue: For doing the same crap he always does, except to a judge. He has to stay in there until he apologizes.

00:13:05:060000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:13:05:060000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:07:070000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:13:07:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:07:070000.Dialogue: Oh, gee, thanks, Leonard. That didn't occur to me. If he doesn't apologize by 5:00, he is going to spend the night in jail.

00:13:14:030000.Scene: A queue outside the comic book store.
00:13:14:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:14:030000.Dialogue: Oh, no, that's terrible. Ooh, the line's moving. Got to go. Bye.

00:13:33:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:33:220000.Dialogue: I need to use the restroom.

00:13:42:090000.Speaker: Guard
00:13:42:090000.Dialogue: Well, it ain't a wishing well.

00:13:46:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:46:010000.Dialogue: Please tell the judge I'm ready to apologize.

00:13:51:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:51:170000.Dialogue: Look at that. "To my friend, Leonard. From Stan Lee, Excelsior!"

00:14:00:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:00:000000.Dialogue: Awesome. Mine says, "To my friend, Howard. From Stan Lee, Excelsior!"

00:14:07:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:07:070000.Dialogue: Mine says, "To Raj, from Stan Lee."

00:14:14:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:14:150000.Dialogue: That's 'cause you pissed him off about his character names.

00:14:16:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:16:200000.Dialogue: Hey, I didn't even mention Dum Dum Dugan or Green Goblin, Matt Murdock, Pepper Potts, Victor Von Doom, oh, and worst of all, Millie the Model.

00:14:30:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:30:160000.Dialogue: Oh, hey, buddy. How'd it go?

00:14:32:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:32:130000.Dialogue: You know very well how it went.

00:14:34:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:34:110000.Dialogue: Yeah, but we all want to hear it from you.

00:14:39:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:39:230000.Dialogue: I was found guilty and fined $533.

00:14:42:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:42:100000.Dialogue: I'm going to write you a check for that. As long as you promise to put it in your drawer and never cash it, like the others.

00:14:51:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:51:160000.Dialogue: I also now have three points on a driver's license I do not yet possess, and I was forced to issue an undeserved apology, simply because I refuse to urinate in a stainless steel bowl in front of criminals.

00:15:04:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:04:170000.Dialogue: Plus, you didn't get to meet Stan Lee.

00:15:08:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:08:060000.Dialogue: Okay, that's enough, Howard. The poor guy's had a tough time. He had to spend the entire afternoon in jail wearing that suit.

00:15:16:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:16:110000.Dialogue: You're right, so it would be cruel to mention that after he finished signing autographs, Stanley took Stuart and us out for gelato.

00:15:26:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:26:160000.Dialogue: You had gelato with Stan Lee?

00:15:29:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:29:220000.Dialogue: He said we could call him Stan.

00:15:39:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:39:160000.Dialogue: Well, I hope you're satisfied, Penny. You are responsible for all the evil that has befallen me today.

00:15:56:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:56:050000.Dialogue: Okay, maybe you'll have another chance to have...

00:16:15:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:15:100000.Dialogue: Did he just somehow give me the finger?

00:16:19:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:19:170000.Dialogue: Not just the finger. The moving finger.

00:16:36:060000.Speaker: Sruart
00:16:36:060000.Dialogue: I'm just getting ready to close up and... head out.

00:16:39:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:39:190000.Dialogue: Ah. Cool. Got any fun plans?

00:16:43:020000.Speaker: Stuart
00:16:43:020000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah. Big night tonight. Gonna share a can of tuna with the cat.

00:16:52:210000.Speaker: Stuart
00:16:52:210000.Dialogue: Not even my cat. I just feed it. Some nights it doesn't even show up.

00:16:59:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:59:060000.Dialogue: Oh, okay. Well, I was hoping, um, you could do me a favor.

00:17:05:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:05:120000.Dialogue: Well, I'm kind of responsible for Sheldon missing Stan Lee, and I really want to make it up to him. So I was hoping you could give me his phone number so maybe I can arrange for them to meet.

00:17:13:210000.Speaker: Stuart
00:17:13:210000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry, I don't have his phone number.

00:17:16:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:16:030000.Dialogue: Hmm. Damn. Mm. All right. Thank you.

00:17:18:200000.Speaker: Stuart
00:17:18:200000.Dialogue: Mm-hmm. Wait. I have his address.

00:17:27:070000.Speaker: Stuart
00:17:27:070000.Dialogue: But I can't give it to you.

00:17:30:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:30:100000.Dialogue: Then why did you tell me you had it?

00:17:36:020000.Speaker: Stuart
00:17:36:020000.Dialogue: You're looking at a guy who could very well get stood up by a stray cat tonight.

00:17:49:060000.Speaker: Stuart
00:17:49:060000.Dialogue: Maybe we can make a deal.

00:17:53:030000.Speaker: Stuart
00:17:53:030000.Dialogue: I will give you the address if you go to my cousin's wedding with me.

00:17:58:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:58:040000.Dialogue: You're extorting a date out of me?

00:17:59:140000.Speaker: Stuart
00:17:59:140000.Dialogue: I kind of have to. The cousin who's getting married is the cousin I usually go to weddings with.

00:18:10:170000.Speaker: Stuart
00:18:10:170000.Dialogue: We'll tell people he's your cousin.

00:18:14:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:14:200000.Dialogue: This is Stan Lee's front door. We were on Stan Lee's curb, then we were on Stan Lee's walk, and now we're at Stan Lee's front door.

00:18:25:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:25:080000.Dialogue: Oh, Lord, you just rang Stan Lee's doorbell. At Stan Lee's house. We're about to go in and have milk and cookies with Stan Lee.

00:18:31:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:31:220000.Dialogue: Okay, sweetie, I don't know if we're gonna have cookies, or he's just gonna say hi, or really what's gonna happen, so just let me talk, and we'll... ?

00:18:47:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:47:100000.Dialogue: Hi. I'm Penny. This is my friend, Sheldon.

00:18:49:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:49:130000.Dialogue: We're not friends at the moment. Depends on how this goes.

00:18:52:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:52:100000.Dialogue: Right, right. Anyway, Sheldon here is a huge fan of yours, and he was supposed to meet you the other day at the comic book store, but he kind of ended up in jail.

00:19:02:160000.Speaker: Stan Lee
00:19:02:160000.Dialogue: I see. And you thought you'd just come over to my house uninvited?

00:19:08:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:08:160000.Dialogue: Oh, no, no, I said I'm inviting you to come with me to Stan Lee's house.

00:19:13:160000.Speaker: Stan Lee
00:19:13:160000.Dialogue: You know, you fan boys are unbelievable. Do you think you can just ring my doorbell any time you want? I mean, why don't you just come on in and watch the Lakers game with me?

00:19:23:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:23:160000.Dialogue: Well, I'm not much of a sports fan, but thank you.

00:19:29:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:29:180000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. He doesn't really understand sarcasm.

00:19:33:020000.Speaker: Stan Lee
00:19:33:020000.Dialogue: Well, I'll give him something he'll understand. Joanie, call the police!

00:19:43:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:43:120000.Dialogue: Fantastic Four, Daredevil, Invincible Iron Man, Happy Hogan, Curt Connors...

00:19:49:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:49:100000.Dialogue: Would you just let it go?

00:19:51:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:51:050000.Dialogue: And worst of all, Fin Fang Foom.

00:20:00:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:00:000000.Dialogue: I'll tell you where I've been. You boys may have had gelato with Stan Lee and gotten autographed comics, but I saw the inside of his house and got an autographed application for a restraining order.

00:20:17:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:17:020000.Dialogue: Plus, I get to hang out with him again at the hearing.

00:20:22:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:22:230000.Dialogue: This is going to look great hanging next to my restraining order from Leonard Nimoy.
